docs.title: MkDocs Software Printer
docs.text: Welcome to the MkDocs Software Printer user guide. This tool automates the creation of a virtual folder structure from MkDocs documentation using AI-powered assistants. It leverages advanced AI models to interpret your documentation and generate a codebase in your preferred programming language.

docs.title: User Guide
docs.text:
• Home
  • Introduction
  • Features
  • Installation
  • Configuration
  • Usage
  • Workflow Overview
  • Advanced Features
  • Troubleshooting

  • Support and Contributions
  • License

docs.title: Technical Documentation
docs.text: • System Documentation

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: MkDocs Software Printer is designed to streamline the process of converting your MkDocs documentation into a functional software project. By utilizing AI models for planning, compression, and debugging, it transforms your documentation into code, saving you time and effort.

docs.title: What is MkDocs Software Printer?
docs.text:
• Automated Code Generation: Generates a project structure based on your MkDocs documentation.
  • AI Integration: Uses AI models for planning, file compression, and debugging tasks.
  • Customizable Language Support: Allows you to specify the programming language for the generated code.

Next: Features

docs.title: Features
docs.text: MkDocs Software Printer offers a range of features to help you quickly generate code from your documentation.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Automated Code Generation
  • Transforms documentation into code in your chosen language.
  • AI-Powered Planning
  • Uses AI to interpret documentation and create a project plan.
  • File Compression AI
  • Merges files with the same name to maintain a clean structure.
  • Experimental Debugger AI
  • Optional feature to refine and debug the generated code.
  • Command-Line Interface
  • Easy-to-use CLI for configuring input and output directories.

Previous: Introduction | Next: Installation

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Follow these steps to install MkDocs Software Printer.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Node.js (version 14 or higher)
  • npm (Node Package Manager)
  • MkDocs documentation files
  • Google Generative AI API Key

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Clone the Repository
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/mkdocs-software-printer.git
cd mkdocs-software-printer
  1. Install Dependencies
npm install
  1. Set Up Environment Variables

Create a .env file in the root directory:

GEMINI_API_KEY=your_api_key_here

Previous: Features | Next: Configuration

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Configure MkDocs Software Printer before running it.

docs.title: API Key Configuration
docs.text:
• Obtain your Google Generative AI API Key from the Google Cloud Console.
  • Ensure the API key has the necessary permissions.
  • Store the API key securely in the .env file.

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
• GEMINI_API_KEY: Your Google Generative AI API Key.

Previous: Installation | Next: Usage

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: Learn how to use MkDocs Software Printer.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
Run the application using:

npm start -- --input <input_directory> --output <output_directory>
  • <input_directory>: Directory with your MkDocs documentation.
  • <output_directory>: Directory where the generated code will be saved.

docs.title: Command-Line Options
docs.text:
• --input: Specifies the input directory.
  • --output: Specifies the output directory.
  • --experimental-debugger: Enables the experimental Debugger AI.

docs.title: Generate Without Debugger
docs.text: npm start -- --input ./docs --output ./output

docs.title: Generate With Debugger
docs.text:
npm start -- --input ./docs --output ./output --experimental-debugger

Previous: Configuration | Next: Workflow Overview

docs.title: Workflow Overview
docs.text: Understand the main steps of the application.

docs.title: 1. MkDocs File Discovery
docs.text:
• Searches for mkdocs.yml in the input directory.
  • Parses MkDocs configurations.

docs.title: 2. Markdown Content Aggregation
docs.text:
• Reads markdown files based on the nav section.
  • Combines content into a single markdown string.

docs.title: 3. AI Planning Phase
docs.text:
• Interacts with the Planning AI.
  • Generates an initial project plan.

docs.title: 4. AI File Compression
docs.text:
• Uses the File Compression AI.
  • Merges files with identical names.

docs.title: 5. Optional Debugging Phase
docs.text:
• Enabled with --experimental-debugger.
  • Refines code using the Debugger AI.

docs.title: 6. Output Generation
docs.text:
• Writes the project to the output directory.
  • Organizes files and folders as per the plan.

Previous: Usage | Next: Advanced Features

docs.title: Advanced Features
docs.text: Explore advanced functionalities.

docs.title: Experimental Debugger AI
docs.text: An optional feature to refine and debug the generated code.

docs.title: Enabling Debugger AI
docs.text:
Add the flag when running:

npm start -- --input ./docs --output ./output --experimental-debugger

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• May impact API usage quotas.
  • Experimental feature; use cautiously.

Previous: Workflow Overview | Next: Troubleshooting

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: Resolve common issues.

docs.title: No mkdocs.yml Files Found
docs.text: • Solution: Ensure your input directory is correct and contains mkdocs.yml.

docs.title: API Key Errors
docs.text: • Solution: Verify your GEMINI_API_KEY in the .env file.

docs.title: Insufficient Permissions
docs.text: • Solution: Check read/write permissions for input/output directories.

docs.title: Exceeded API Quota
docs.text: • Solution: Monitor your API usage and request higher quotas if needed.

docs.title: Logging and Debugging
docs.text:
• Review console logs for detailed information.

Previous: Advanced Features | Next: FAQ

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
docs.text: Find answers to common questions.

docs.title: Q1: What programming languages are supported?
docs.text: A: You can specify any programming language when prompted. The AI models will attempt to generate code in that language based on your documentation.

docs.title: Q2: How can I customize the AI interactions?
docs.text: A: Currently, AI interactions are managed internally. Future versions may offer more customization options.

docs.title: Q3: Is my documentation sent to external services?
docs.text: A: Yes, the markdown content is sent to AI models for processing. Ensure you're comfortable with this before using the application.

docs.title: Q4: Can I run this application without an internet connection?
docs.text: A: No, internet access is required to interact with the AI services.

docs.title: Q5: How do I contribute to the project?
docs.text:
A: Contributions are welcome! See Support and Contributions for details.

Previous: Troubleshooting | Next: Support and Contributions

docs.title: Support and Contributions
docs.text: Learn how to get support and contribute.

docs.title: Reporting Issues
docs.text: • Submit issues via the GitHub Issues page.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
• Fork the repository.
  • Create pull requests for enhancements or bug fixes.
  • Ensure all tests pass before submitting.

docs.title: Contact Information
docs.text:
For support or inquiries, please contact:

  • GitHub: https://github.com/spirit-riddle/mkdocs-software-printer/
